item.title: Check if your IKEA chair is compatible with your screen
item.description: - IKEA has developed an AR app that allows customers to see how IKEA products, like chairs, will look in their home before they buy.

item.title: Tell HN: Cloudflare verification is breaking the internet
item.description: - Cloudflare, a popular internet infrastructure company, is experiencing an intermittent outage caused by a bug in their DNS verification process.

item.title: Driver adventures for a 1999 webcam
item.description: - Drivers stop being made for devices leading to obsolescence even for devices with consistent connectors like USB.

item.title: Is Gmail killing independent email?
item.description: - Gmail's spam filtering is causing some self-hosted emails to end up in spam folders, limiting options for people and businesses who want their emails to be reliably received by Gmail.

item.title: Microsoft exec says Windows 11 kernel will soon be booting with Rust inside
item.description: Microsoft's EVP Jason Zander has revealed that the company plans to incorporate Rust into Windows 11's kernel.

item.title: Beautiful branchless binary search
item.description: - The article discusses a branchless binary search algorithm called "Shar's algorithm" described in a book written by John Bentley in 1982.

item.title: How to spend money on your friends without it looking like bribery
item.description: - It can be awkward when friends offer to pay for things like dinner or a vacation rental, as it can feel like a direct wealth transfer instead of a genuine gesture of generosity.

item.title: A small number of companies are colluding to cheat H1B visa lottery, US says
item.description: - US Citizenship and Immigration Services found evidence of small technology companies colluding to improve chances of winning an H-1B visa for skilled foreign workers in this year's lottery.

item.title: Europe's Longest Bicycling Tunnel Opens in Norway
item.description: - Europe's longest bicycling tunnel has opened in Norway.

item.title: Gpt4free repo given takedown notice by OpenAI
item.description: - OpenAI's legal team has issued a takedown notice to the Gpt4free repository on GitHub.
